content.content:
diff --git a/docker-compose.yml b/docker-compose.yml
index 2851494..fd64977 100644
--- a/docker-compose.yml
+++ b/docker-compose.yml
@@ -81,7 +81,7 @@ services:
       - "traefik.http.routers.dora-api.entrypoints=websecure"
       - "traefik.http.services.dora-api.loadbalancer.server.port=8000"
       # Basic auth middleware for /v1/chat/completions endpoint
-      - "traefik.http.middlewares.dora-auth.basicauth.users=admin:$$2y$$10$$8K1p3kbJGmnCBBMJTlscUuezPCZJkp4I5JNGfJeRPSjhRu6XfLkhy"
+      - "traefik.http.middlewares.dora-auth.basicauth.users=admin:$$2b$$12$$5riNOzrVSUhIo/SvAaJSM.8gtkgbEJzfKoe3K.0L3dLNKiNuT4P42"
       - "traefik.http.routers.dora-api-chat.rule=Host(`al-vizier.haet.ru`) && PathPrefix(`/v1/chat/completions`)"
       - "traefik.http.routers.dora-api-chat.tls=true"
       - "traefik.http.routers.dora-api-chat.tls.certresolver=letsencrypt"
@@ -120,4 +120,4 @@ services:
 
 networks:
   dora-network:
-    driver: bridge
\ No newline at end of file
+    driver: bridge
diff --git a/pyproject.toml b/pyproject.toml
index afa3982..550d1fa 100644
--- a/pyproject.toml
+++ b/pyproject.toml
@@ -22,6 +22,7 @@ dependencies = [
     "fastapi>=0.115.12",
     "uvicorn>=0.34.2",
     "aiohttp>=3.12.2",
+    "bcrypt>=4.3.0",
 ]
 
 [project.optional-dependencies]

content.text:
<commit_analysis>
- Files changed: docker-compose.yml, pyproject.toml, uv.lock
- Changes include: Updated bcrypt hash for basic auth in Traefik configuration, added bcrypt dependency to pyproject.toml, and corresponding lock file updates
- This appears to be updating the authentication system with a new password hash and ensuring the bcrypt dependency is properly included
- The changes improve security by updating the authentication credentials and ensuring proper dependency management
- No sensitive information is being committed - just configuration changes and dependency updates
- The commit message should focus on updating authentication and dependencies
</commit_analysis>

input.description: Stage the modified files for commit

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Update authentication hash and add bcrypt dependency

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

content.text:
The authentication works! The endpoint responded with an error about city search, which means the basic auth with admin:admin123 credentials is working correctly. The error is coming from the application logic, not authentication failure.

Let me test with a simpler request to get a cleaner response:

input.command: curl -u admin:admin123 -X POST https://al-vizier.haet.ru/v1/chat/completions -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"model":"gpt-4","messages":[{"role":"user","content":"What is the capital of France?"}],"max_tokens":50}' -s
